name: Ojingeo Bokkeum (Squid with Chillies and Vegetables)
author: Madhur Jaffrey
source: A Taste of the Far East, pg.99
ingredients:
- 560g cleaned squid
- 3 tbsp vegetable oil
- 1 medium carrot
- 1 medium onion
- 1 small courgette
- 3 green chillies
- 3 red chillies
- 2 cloves garlic, peeled and crushed
- 3 tsp gochujang
- 2 tsp gochugaru
- 1 tsp sugar
- 2 spring onions, cut into 4cm lengths
- 2 tsp roasted sesame seeds
- 2 tsp sesame oil
- salt and black pepper
instructions:
- Open up the squid and cut into 6x1cm lengths. Cut the tentacles to 6cm lengths.
- Cut the carrots to 6cm by 3mm chunks.
- Slice the onion and courgette.
- De-seed and halve the chillies.

- Bring 2.25ltr water to a rolling boil, then turn off the heat and drop in the squid pieces.
- Stir the squid for 40 seconds until it turns white, and drain.

- Heat the vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat, and when hot, put in the garlic, onion, carrots and a pinch of salt.
- Stir and cook for 30 seconds, then put in the courgette, chillies, 2 tsp gochujang, 1 tsp gochugaru. Stir and cook for 30 seconds.
- Put in the squid, and turn the heat to medium-low. Add the remaining 1 tsp gochujang, 1 tsp gochugaru, a pinch of black pepper, 1 tsp salt, and 1tsp sugar. Stir to mix and cook gently for 2 minutes.
- Add the spring onions and sesame oil, stir in, and serve with the roasted sesame seeds on top.
